yes, I need the partition table.
I think dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/yourdrive bs=466 count=1   would do it, I think..
that should erase the code area of the MBR, according to wikipedia
You don't sound very confident;)
well the mbr contains the partition table as well, but I'm pretty sure the partition table is the last 66 bytes of the 512B mbr
to be safe, you could dd if=/dev/yourdrive of=mbr_backup.img bs=512 count=1  and copy it off somewhere safe
then write the zeroes, and if it somehow fails miserably, just write the backup back ala dd if=mbr_backup.img of=/dev/yourdrive
Sweet! I think that did it!
